看.definition: to see; to look at; to read; to watch; to visit; to call on; to consider; to regard as; to look after; to treat (a patient or illness); to depend on; to feel (that); (after a verb) to give it a try; to watch out for

看上.definition: to look upon; to take a fancy to; to fall for

看不慣.definition: cannot bear to see; to hate; to dislike; to disapprove

看不懂.definition: unable to make sense of what one is looking at

看不見.definition: cannot see; cannot be seen; invisible

看不起.definition: to look down upon; to despise

看不過.definition: cannot stand by idly and watch; unable to put up with it any longer; see 看不過去|看不过去[kan4 bu5 guo4 qu5]

看不過去.definition: cannot stand by idly and watch; unable to put up with it any longer

看中.definition: to have a preference for; to fancy; to choose after consideration; to settle on

看人下菜碟兒.pinyin: kan4 ren2 xia4 cai4 die2 r5
看人下菜碟兒.definition: (dialect) to treat sb according to their social status, relationship with them etc (idiom); not to treat everyone equally favorably

看人行事.definition: to treat people according to their rank and one's relationship with them (idiom)

看似.definition: to look as if; to seem

看作.definition: to look upon as; to regard as

看做.definition: to regard as; to look upon as

看呆.definition: to gape at; to stare blankly; to stare in rapture; to stare in awe

看在.definition: (in the expression 看在[kan4 zai4] + ... + 的份上[de5 fen4 shang5]) for the sake of ...; considering ...

看在眼裡.definition: to observe; to take it all in

看好.definition: to regard as having good prospects

看官.definition: (old) (used by novelists) dear readers; (used by storytellers) dear audience members

看家.definition: to look after the house; (of skill, ability) special; outstanding

看得中.definition: to take a liking for; to fancy

看得起.definition: to show respect for; to think highly of

看得過兒.definition: erhua variant of 看得過|看得过[kan4 de5 guo4]

看慣.definition: to be used to the sight of

看懂.definition: to understand what one is reading or watching

看戲.definition: to watch a play; to watch passively (i.e. from the sidelines, from the crowd)

看扁.definition: to have a low opinion of

看押.definition: to detain; to take into custody; to imprison temporarily

看望.definition: to pay a visit to; to see (sb)

看樣子.definition: it seems; it looks as if

看法.definition: way of looking at a thing; view; opinion; CL:個|个[ge4]

看淡.definition: to regard as unimportant; to be indifferent to (fame, wealth etc); (of an economy or a market) to slacken

看準.definition: to observe and make sure; to check

看準機會.definition: to watch for an opportunity; to see one's chance to

看漲.definition: bull market (prices appear to be rising)

看熱鬧.definition: to enjoy watching a bustling scene; to go where the crowds are

看球.definition: to watch a football game (or other ball game); Fore! (golf); Watch out for the ball!

看病.definition: to visit a doctor; to see a patient

看相.definition: to tell fortune by reading the subject's facial features

看看.definition: to take a look at; to examine; to survey; (coll.) pretty soon

看破.definition: to see through; disillusioned with; to reject (the world of mortals)

看破紅塵.definition: (idiom) to see through the illusions of the material world (often a precursor to becoming a Buddhist monk or nun); to become disillusioned with human society

看穿.definition: see through (a person, scheme, trick etc)

看笑話.definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself

看花眼.definition: to be dazzled; to not believe one's own eyes

看菜吃飯.definition: lit. to eat depending on the dish (idiom); fig. to act according to actual circumstances

看菜吃飯，量體裁衣.pinyin: kan4 cai4 chi1 fan4 , liang4 ti3 cai2 yi1
看菜吃飯，量體裁衣.definition: lit. to eat depending on the dish, cut cloth according to the body (idiom); fig. to act according to actual circumstances

看著不管.definition: to stand by and pay no heed; to ignore

看著辦.definition: to do as one sees fit; to play it by ear (according to the circumstances)

看見.definition: to see; to catch sight of

看診.definition: (of a doctor) to see a patient; to give a consultation; (of a patient) to see a doctor

看護.definition: to nurse; to look after; to watch over; (old) hospital nurse

看貶.definition: to expect (a currency etc) to depreciate

看走眼.definition: to make an error of judgment; to be taken in

看起來.definition: seemingly; apparently; looks as if; appears to be; gives the impression that; seems on the face of it to be

看輕.definition: to belittle; to scorn; to take sth lightly

看透.definition: to understand thoroughly; to see beyond the facade; to see through (sb)

看重.definition: to regard as important; to value

看錯.definition: to misinterpret what one sees or reads; to misjudge (sb); to mistake (sb for sb else); to misread (a document)

看開.definition: to come to accept an unpleasant fact; to get over sth; to cheer up

看頭.definition: qualities that make sth worth seeing (or reading)

看齊.definition: to follow sb's example; to emulate; (of troops etc) to dress (come into alignment for parade formation)
